detaileddescription.para: Array of per-adc/per-channel buffers. adc_channel_buffers[x][y][z][] is ADC x+1 channel y buffer z with z either 0 or 1 as there are two buffers per channel (double buffering)
Number of readings stored in each channel. buffers_data_count[x][y] is the current number of values stored in the currently written buffer of ADC x+1 Channel y
Currently written buffer for each channel. Either 0 or 1. If current_buffer[x][y] is 0, the currently written buffer for ADC x+1 Channel y is buffer 0 and the user buffer is buffer 1
Small memory to retain latest value available to the peek() function after a buffer swap.

DMA buffers: data from the ADC 1/2 are stored in these buffers until dispatch is done (ADC 3/4 won't use DMA). Main buffers are always used, while secondary buffers will only be used when double-buffering is activated. Double buffering is activated in Interrupt mode, while Task mode doesn't need it.

briefdescription.para: Init function to be called first.

inbodydescription.para: Make sure buffer size is a multiple of enabled channels count so that each channel data will always be at the same position
Add room for one additional measure per channel. This prevents DMA buffer to do exactly one rotation between two tasks calls, to prevent edge cases in acquired data count computation.

briefdescription.para: Dispatch function: gets the readings and store them in per-channel arrays. This function is called by DMA callback when the DMA has filled one of its buffers.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the ADC from which data comes.

briefdescription.para: Function to proceed to all chanels dispatch when it is done at uninterruptible task start.
Obtain data for a specific channel. The data is provided as an array of values and the count of data in this buffer is returned as an output parameter.
Peek data for a specific channel: obtain the latest value from the channel without removing it from the buffer.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the ADC from which to obtain data.
Rank of the channel from which to obtain data.

simplesect.para: Latest available value from the buffer. Note that if no value has been acquired, returned value will be 0.
